courage.5: Faces challenges head-on, overcomes fear with action, stands for principles even when difficult.
courage.4: Generally confrontational, occasionally struggles with specific fears, defends principles most of the time.
courage.3: Avoids difficult situations, succumbs to fear, compromises principles for comfort.
courage.2: Lacks initiative, paralyzed by fear, readily abandons convictions.
courage.1: Avoids conflict at all costs, readily conforms to external pressures.

wisdom.5: Recognizes impermanence with acceptance, discerns control from influence, prioritizes needs over wants.
wisdom.4: Mostly accepting of life's changes, occasionally struggles with control or desires.
wisdom.3: Confuses internal and external control, prioritizes wants over needs frequently.
wisdom.2: Resists acceptance, blames external factors, driven by impulsive desires.
wisdom.1: Clinging to control, unable to distinguish needs, consumes impulsively.

justice.5: Treats everyone fairly, speaks out against injustice even when challenged, promotes equality.
justice.4: Generally upholds the Golden Rule, occasionally avoids injustice or compromises fairness.
justice.3: Favors certain individuals, remains silent about injustice, prioritizes personal gain over equity.
justice.2: Actively participates in injustice, lacks empathy or understanding of fairness.
justice.1: Exploits others, disregards needs of others, engages in discriminatory behavior.

temperance.5: Maintains balance in abundance and scarcity, controls desires, speaks with intention and restraint.
temperance.4: Mostly avoids excess, occasionally indulges in moderation, mindful of words.
temperance.3: Struggles with balance, prone to excesses, speaks impulsively or negatively.
temperance.2: Frequently succumbs to desires, lacks self-control, engages in gossip or hurtful words.
temperance.1: Consumed by excess, lacks discipline, speaks carelessly and impulsively.
